DataElement.preferredName: In Situ Hybridization Probe Cell Line With Genetic Change Tested Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if the DNA probe was tested on cell lines that have a genetic change.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: In Situ Hybridization Probe Cell Line With Genetic Change Tested
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues_General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._A mark that is long relative to its width; a length (straight or curved) without breadth or thickness; the trace of a moving point._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited._alteration or modification._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

Property.preferredName: Cell Line With Genetic Change Test
Property.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:A mark that is long relative to its width; a length (straight or curved) without breadth or thickness; the trace of a moving point.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:alteration or modification.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A mark that is long relative to its width; a length (straight or curved) without breadth or thickness; the trace of a moving point.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes/ No/ Unknown/ Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Yes, no, unknown or not applicable responses to a question or condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

PermissibleValues.origin: LCBCC:Lung Cancer Biomarkers and Chemoprevention Consortium

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
